The first floor is for general supplies like food (eggs, snacks, dairy, fruit, vegetables), health, personal care, etc.
On the second floor, you'll find wardrobe and beauty section including skincare and clothes
The third floor is for kitchenware, stationery, electronics, etc

Every place has its pros and cons. The cons are that there aren't too many meat and imported product choices. Also, be prepared to wait  more than 15 minutes to get through the checkout line

But hey, I still give it 5 stars because Mirota has been a lifesaver for me and holds good memories with my friends.

I recently visited Mirota Kampus and I must say, it's a good place. Mirota offers a comfortable shopping environment, and what's even better is the affordable price, or I can say "anak kos friendly" price. From groceries to skincare, stationery, clothing, and electronics, everything is reasonably priced. The staff members are friendly and always ready to assist. Beside that, Mirota Kampus is conveniently located near my campus and my place, making it a go-to store for me to shop for daily essentials.
The only downside I experienced was the slow cashier service. Even for customers with just a few items, it took quite a long time. Maybe improving the speed and efficiency of the checkout process would greatly enhance the overall experience.
Despite that, Mirota Kampus remains a go-to store for me due to its comfortable ambiance, affordability, friendly staff, and its convenient proximity to campus and student accommodations. With a few improvements, it can truly be an exceptional shopping destination.
